ygData.subject: Re: Hrmm
ygData.msgSnippet: The lake outside of Halas was clear a few months ago when I was swimming around bored with my warrior.  However, they might have itemized it. -Kryogen Katspaw
ygData.messageBody:
The lake outside of Halas was clear a few months ago when I was swimming around
bored with my warrior. However, they might have itemized it.

-Kryogen Katspaw

--- Nick Bock <nickbock@...> wrote:
> Hey guys,
>
> If the clue was to look below waves, and before it was stated that a
> Barbarian Shaman would do the exploring, what about the lake outside of
> Halas? Has that already been brought up? If need be, I can take my
> Magician up there and poke around?
>
> Xalastile
> lvl 22 magician
> xegony
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Zach Heaven <zheaven@...>
> To: <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, October 05, 1999 12:53 AM
> Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] lindel
>
>
> > From: Zach Heaven <zheaven@...>
> >
> > Heh.
> >
> > That hole is huge. If you swim down far enough you hit... NOTHING! I
> even
> > scraped the walls to see if I could find a secret room, nothing. Anywho.
> I
> > scanned all of Ak'anon today underwater (145 swimming currently). Didn't
> see
> > anything cool to note. Scanned for about an hour or so. Was a waste of
> time I
> > think.
> >
> > -Kryogen Katspaw
> >
> > --- Tony Buser <gr0k@...> wrote:
> > > Well I hate to say it, but it wasn't much of a clue. I mean... there's
> a
> > > LOT of water in the game. Could be anywhere.
> > >
> > > Though one time I thought there might be something under all that water
> in
> > > ak'anon and I swam around all one day. Didn't find anything. I did
> find a
> > > place where you can swim behind the wall out in front of the mines where
> the
> > > Necro guild is, but I drowned and had to call a gm to get my corpse out.
> > > Maybe I'll see if I can find someone to cast endureing breath so I can
> > > search in there more fully.
> > >
> > > ---
> > > gr0k - Stranger in a Strange Land - http://www.juju.org
> > > "Linux... find out what you've been missing while
> > > you've been rebooting Windows NT" - Infoworld
> > >
